title: The Garmin Dash Cam 67W plunges to a new record-low price!
description: Keep your eyes on the road, and throw in a dash cam just in case.
author: Edgar Cervantes
excerpt: Are you looking for a dash cam? The Garmin Dash Cam 67W is our favorite one, and it is cheaper than ever right now.
text: We usually don’t think twice about hopping in a car and heading somewhere, but when things go wrong, it’s better to be safe than sorry. This is why dash cams are becoming so popular. The Garmin Dash Cam 67W happens to be our very favorite one, and it’s currently cheaper than ever! Get the Garmin Dash Cam 67W for just $179.99 ($80 off)This Garmin Dash Cam 67W offer is available from Amazon. It’s labeled as a “limited time deal,” which means the discount is applied automatically. Just add it to your cart and check out!The Garmin Dash Cam 67W still sits at the top of our list of the best dash cams, so you know you’re in for a treat with this one. We don’t exactly like it for being the absolute best, though. We believe it is the best for the money, offering a perfect balance between price and quality. Most people will love it.It helps that this one comes from Garmin, a renowned and respected brand in the industry. A lot of these dash cams come from brands most people have never heard of before. Buying from a recognized company will always give customers more peace of mind, especially if you care about customer support.I don’t know about you, but I am also not a fan of those huge dash cams that become an eyesore when mounted on your windshield. This one is only 5.62 x 4.05 x 2.19cm. It’s discrete and subtle, and despite its small size, it’s actually quite capable.The Garmin Dash Cam 67W will record at 1,440p resolution, with a frame rate of 60fps. It’s sharp and smooth. It also covers a 180-degree field of view, so it keeps more in view while driving. The two-inch screen can also give you a live view of what the camera is recording.The unit actually comes with its own battery, too, and it can operate for up to 30 minutes on a full charge. It’s meant to be plugged into the car’s power source, though, so that battery is only there as support. It can monitor your vehicle while parked, for example. Other features include incident detection, GPS, voice commands, lane departure warnings, forward collision warnings, and even “go alerts” for when cars start moving.You’ll have two options for storing your activity. It supports local storage, but you can also get cloud storage and extra features if you opt for a Garmin Vault subscription.Once again, this is a record-low price we’ve never seen before. You might want to act quickly if you want to score a Garmin Dash Cam 67W for only $179.99. We’re not sure how long the offer will stand.
html:
We usually don’t think twice about hopping in a car and heading somewhere, but when things go wrong, it’s better to be safe than sorry. This is why dash cams are becoming so popular. The Garmin Dash Cam 67W happens to be our very favorite one, and it’s currently cheaper than ever!

Get the Garmin Dash Cam 67W for just $179.99 ($80 off)

This Garmin Dash Cam 67W offer is available from Amazon. It’s labeled as a “limited time deal,” which means the discount is applied automatically. Just add it to your cart and check out!

The Garmin Dash Cam 67W still sits at the top of our list of the best dash cams, so you know you’re in for a treat with this one. We don’t exactly like it for being the absolute best, though. We believe it is the best for the money, offering a perfect balance between price and quality. Most people will love it.

It helps that this one comes from Garmin, a renowned and respected brand in the industry. A lot of these dash cams come from brands most people have never heard of before. Buying from a recognized company will always give customers more peace of mind, especially if you care about customer support.

I don’t know about you, but I am also not a fan of those huge dash cams that become an eyesore when mounted on your windshield. This one is only 5.62 x 4.05 x 2.19cm. It’s discrete and subtle, and despite its small size, it’s actually quite capable.

The Garmin Dash Cam 67W will record at 1,440p resolution, with a frame rate of 60fps. It’s sharp and smooth. It also covers a 180-degree field of view, so it keeps more in view while driving. The two-inch screen can also give you a live view of what the camera is recording.

The unit actually comes with its own battery, too, and it can operate for up to 30 minutes on a full charge. It’s meant to be plugged into the car’s power source, though, so that battery is only there as support. It can monitor your vehicle while parked, for example. Other features include incident detection, GPS, voice commands, lane departure warnings, forward collision warnings, and even “go alerts” for when cars start moving.

You’ll have two options for storing your activity. It supports local storage, but you can also get cloud storage and extra features if you opt for a Garmin Vault subscription.

Once again, this is a record-low price we’ve never seen before. You might want to act quickly if you want to score a Garmin Dash Cam 67W for only $179.99. We’re not sure how long the offer will stand.
